text:
ROHIT DESHPANDE: So the Creating
Emerging Markets project

is this wonderful
collection of interviews

with senior leaders in countries
that we don't know that much

about, or certainly
of their industries,
we don't know that much about.

And these are people
who talk about not only

their involvement
in transforming

their organizations, having
huge impact on their industries,

but really making a
profound social impact.

And what's really provocative
about this project

is that these leaders go beyond
the bounds of what we normally

think about as leadership
within an industry.

And they talk about really
transforming the country
through the work that they do.

As new ventures are
created, as entrepreneurs

think about building
new things and giving

the world new
ventures, they're going

to have to come to
terms with this notion

of public and private
actually co-mingling.

And that's what this
project, I think, can do.

By standing on the
shoulders of giants,

it can show young
entrepreneurs how

they can create something
new that actually brings

social responsibility into
the guts of an organization,

rather than treating it as
a dotted-line relationship.
